content: King James II was a monarch who ruled England, Scotland, and Ireland from 1685 until 1688. He was born on October 14, 1633 and was the second son of King Charles I. James ascended to the throne after the death of his older brother, King Charles II, and faced many challenges during his reign. Despite his efforts to promote religious tolerance and establish a more equitable society, he faced opposition from Parliament and was eventually overthrown in the Glorious Revolution of 1688. He spent the rest of his life in exile, dying on September 16, 1701. Throughout his life, James was known for his strong belief in the divine right of kings and his steadfast commitment to his Catholic faith. Despite the challenges he faced, he remained resolute in his beliefs and steadfast in his commitment to his people.
